verses.verse: Then Samuel<WH8050> took<WH3947> a vial<WH6378> of oil<WH8081>, and poured<WH3332> it upon his head<WH7218>, and kissed<WH5401> him, and said<WH559>, Is it not because the LORD<WH3068> hath anointed<WH4886> thee to be captain<WH5057> over his inheritance<WH5159>?

When thou art departed<WH3212> from me<WH5978> to day<WH3117>, then thou shalt find<WH4672> two<WH8147> men<WH582> by Rachel's<WH7354> sepulchre<WH6900> in the border<WH1366> of Benjamin<WH1144> at Zelzah<WH6766>; and they will say<WH559> unto thee, The asses<WH860> which thou wentest<WH1980> to seek<WH1245> are found<WH4672>: and, lo, thy father<WH1> hath left<WH5203> the care<WH1697> of the asses<WH860>, and sorroweth<WH1672> for you, saying<WH559>, What shall I do<WH6213> for my son<WH1121>?

Then shalt thou go on<WH2498> forward<WH1973> from thence, and thou shalt come<WH935> to the plain<WH436> of Tabor<WH8396>, and there shall meet<WH4672> thee three<WH7969> men<WH582> going up<WH5927> to God<WH430> to Beth-el<WH1008>, one<WH259> carrying<WH5375> three<WH7969> kids<WH1423>, and another<WH259> carrying<WH5375> three<WH7969> loaves<WH3603> of bread<WH3899>, and another<WH259> carrying<WH5375> a bottle<WH5035> of wine<WH3196>:
And they will<WH7592> salute<WH7965> thee, and give<WH5414> thee two<WH8147> loaves of bread<WH3899>; which thou shalt receive<WH3947> of their hands<WH3027>.

After<WH310> that thou shalt come<WH935> to the hill<WH1389> of God<WH430>, where is the garrison<WH5333> of the Philistines<WH6430>: and it shall come to pass, when thou art come thither<WH935> to the city<WH5892>, that thou shalt meet<WH6293> a company<WH2256> of prophets<WH5030> coming down<WH3381> from the high place<WH1116> with a psaltery<WH5035>, and a tabret<WH8596>, and a pipe<WH2485>, and a harp<WH3658>, before<WH6440> them; and they shall prophesy<WH5012>:
And the Spirit<WH7307> of the LORD<WH3068> will come<WH6743> upon thee, and thou shalt prophesy<WH5012> with them, and shalt be turned<WH2015> into another<WH312> man<WH376>.
And let it be, when these signs<WH226> are come<WH935> unto thee, that thou do<WH6213> as occasion<WH4672> serve<WH3027> thee; for God<WH430> is with thee.

And thou shalt go down<WH3381> before<WH6440> me to Gilgal<WH1537>; and, behold, I will come down<WH3381> unto thee, to offer<WH5927> burnt offerings<WH5930>, and to sacrifice<WH2076> sacrifices<WH2077> of peace offerings<WH8002>: seven<WH7651> days<WH3117> shalt thou tarry<WH3176>, till I come<WH935> to thee, and shew<WH3045> thee what thou shalt do<WH6213>.

¶ And it was so, that when he had turned<WH6437> his back<WH7926> to go<WH3212> from Samuel<WH8050>, God<WH430> gave<WH2015> him another<WH312> heart<WH3820>: and all those signs<WH226> came<WH935> to pass that day<WH3117>.

And when they came<WH935> thither to the hill<WH1389>, behold, a company<WH2256> of prophets<WH5030> met<WH7125> him; and the Spirit<WH7307> of God<WH430> came<WH6743> upon him, and he prophesied<WH5012> among<WH8432> them.

And it came to pass, when all that knew<WH3045> him beforetime<WH865><WH8032> saw<WH7200> that, behold, he prophesied<WH5012> among the prophets<WH5030>, then the people<WH5971> said<WH559> one<WH376> to another<WH7453>, What is this that is come unto the son<WH1121> of Kish<WH7027>? Is Saul<WH7586> also among the prophets<WH5030>?
And one<WH376> of the same place answered<WH6030> and said<WH559>, But who is their father<WH1>? Therefore it became a proverb<WH4912>, Is Saul<WH7586> also among the prophets<WH5030>?
And when he had made an end<WH3615> of prophesying<WH5012>, he came<WH935> to the high place<WH1116>.

¶ And Saul's<WH7586> uncle<WH1730> said<WH559> unto him and to his servant<WH5288>, Whither<WH575> went<WH1980> ye? And he said<WH559>, To seek<WH1245> the asses<WH860>: and when we saw<WH7200> that they were no where<WH369>, we came<WH935> to Samuel<WH8050>.
And Saul's<WH7586> uncle<WH1730> said<WH559>, Tell<WH5046> me, I pray thee, what Samuel<WH8050> said<WH559> unto you.

And Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> unto his uncle<WH1730>, He told<WH5046> us plainly<WH5046> that the asses<WH860> were found<WH4672>. But of the matter<WH1697> of the kingdom<WH4410>, whereof Samuel<WH8050> spake<WH559>, he told<WH5046> him not.
¶ And Samuel<WH8050> called<WH6817> the people<WH5971> together unto the LORD<WH3068> to Mizpeh<WH4709>;

And said<WH559> unto the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, Thus saith<WH559> the LORD<WH3068> God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, I brought up<WH5927> Israel<WH3478> out of Egypt<WH4714>, and delivered<WH5337> you out of the hand<WH3027> of the Egyptians<WH4714>, and out of the hand<WH3027> of all kingdoms<WH4467>, and of them that oppressed<WH3905> you:

And ye have this day<WH3117> rejected<WH3988> your God<WH430>, who himself saved<WH3467> you out of all your adversities<WH7451> and your tribulations<WH6869>; and ye have said<WH559> unto him, Nay, but set<WH7760> a king<WH4428> over us. Now therefore present<WH3320> yourselves before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068> by your tribes<WH7626>, and by your thousands<WH505>.
And when Samuel<WH8050> had caused all the tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478> to come near<WH7126>, the tribe<WH7626> of Benjamin<WH1144> was taken<WH3920>.

When he had caused the tribe<WH7626> of Benjamin<WH1144> to come near<WH7126> by their families<WH4940>, the family<WH4940> of Matri<WH4309> was taken<WH3920>, and Saul<WH7586> the son<WH1121> of Kish<WH7027> was taken<WH3920>: and when they sought<WH1245> him, he could not be found<WH4672>.

Therefore they inquired<WH7592> of the LORD<WH3068> further, if the man<WH376> should yet come<WH935> thither<WH1988>. And the LORD<WH3068> answered<WH559>, Behold, he hath hid<WH2244> himself among the stuff<WH3627>.

And they ran<WH7323> and fetched<WH3947> him thence: and when he stood<WH3320> among<WH8432> the people<WH5971>, he was higher<WH1361> than any of the people<WH5971> from his shoulders<WH7926> and upward<WH4605>.

And Samuel<WH8050> said<WH559> to all the people<WH5971>, See<WH7200> ye him whom the LORD<WH3068> hath chosen<WH977>, that there is none like him among all the people<WH5971>? And all the people<WH5971> shouted<WH7321>, and said<WH559>, God save<WH2421> the king<WH4428>.

Then Samuel<WH8050> told<WH1696> the people<WH5971> the manner<WH4941> of the kingdom<WH4410>, and wrote<WH3789> it in a book<WH5612>, and laid it up<WH3240> before<WH6440> the LORD<WH3068>. And Samuel<WH8050> sent<WH7971> all the people<WH5971> away<WH7971>, every man<WH376> to his house<WH1004>.
¶ And Saul<WH7586> also went<WH1980> home<WH1004> to Gibeah<WH1390>; and there went<WH3212> with him a band of men<WH2428>, whose hearts<WH3820> God<WH430> had touched<WH5060>.
But the children<WH1121> of Belial<WH1100> said<WH559>, How shall this man save<WH3467> us? And they despised<WH959> him, and brought<WH935> him no presents<WH4503>. But he held his peace<WH2790>.
